Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Kestutis B
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, but *** stars only. Helpfull staff, good security, lots of house gadgets. Quite good value for the price in Miami

Reviews.Title: “below average suite”
Reviews.Author: rlevin84
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Toronto to stay at The Mutiny Hotel last week for a family members wedding. All members part of the wedding party and family stayed at this hotel. We booked 6 months in advance a two bedroom suite. We were originally very excited to stay at this hotel from all the reviews and pictures. When we got to the hotel and shown our suite we were EXTREMELY disappointed. If you do stay at this hotel, please avoid room 214. the carpets were stained and unevenly placed. The furniture and kitchen was very outdated compared to the other suites in the hotel. There was no washer/dryer in this suite as well (very important if you're planning to stay for a while). The A/C was incredibly loud, we had to sleep with all of our room doors closed that's how loud it was. Since the wedding party stayed at this hotel, we visited many suites which were beautiful and had a great view. We were given a very outdated and old suite which we did not understand why due to the fact that we were all paying the same amount! We did complain to the manager, they did nothing for us however did include 2 bottles of wine in our room for our inconvenience. They did not adjust the price at our check out. I will never stay at this hotel again and advise travelers to know that not all suites look like the ones in the pic!

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: Leslie B
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity for the first time to stay at the Mutiny Hotel in Miami Florida. THe expierience was great, the service was great,a s well as the accomodations, the employees, the neatness and clean room and the reservation process and check out was simple and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect alternative to a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica P
Reviews.Content: I was wary to stay at a condo since the units are privately owned, but we had a great time here. It's perfectly located if you want to stay in the grove - in Miami you need a car, but here is a great hotel where you can easily walk to several good restaurants, not-so-bad shopping, theatre, comedy club...etc. The bus stop is also right across the street, which takes you around the grove or to the metro-rail station. We weren't necessarily in Miami as tourists, so I can't say much about access to ease of getting to more touristy locations. The staff was very friendly, the rooms are operated like a hotel room - it was cleaned each day (later in the afternoon - our preference), and they offered room service and the front desk and doorman was always available. Our room was very clean - the kitchen and living room are an added bonus to an amazing price we scored. Some of the appliances were a bit dated, but for the price, location, cleanliness and overall comfort of the room and building it was a minor problem. Because we weren't visiting Miami to stay next to the beach, we didn't opt for the amazing view, but we were pleased anyway, but I guess if you want a better view, do as other posters suggest and ask for a specific view.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Mutiny hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louwrens65
Reviews.Content: We stay here during our christmasholiday. It's a fine hotel with large rooms, a complete kitchen, and a nice garden with swimmingpool. It is a good and nice neighbourhood, cocunut grove.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Eve335
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night on December 30th, and it was a great way to start our pre-cruise holiday. The pool patio was a nice place to eat lunch and breakfast, the food was good and reasonably priced. It was too bad we weren't staying longer because our one-bedroom suite was fantastic. There were shops and lots of restaurants to eat within just a couple of blocks walking distance. You will definitely want to try out "LOKAL", a newly opened gourmet burger/beer restaurant about 1 1/2 blocks away on Commodore. We are already talking about coming back for a longer stay, and checking out Little Havana next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jubylu
Reviews.Content: Simply lovely hotel a few mins walk from Coconut Grove. Lovely sea views. The pool area is secluded and well maintained and surrounded by tropical garden plants. Service is brilliant and the cocktails in the bar are worth every cent. Rooms are very big with lovely big balconies and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service was bad”
Reviews.Author: Mocha W
Reviews.Content: Great location, room was big and clean but cable tv was not working, when we informed the front desk clerk, he simply stated that it was broken. Valet parking attendant was very rude. For the price you pay to stay plus the added $21 to valet, they can afford training to work on their people skills.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spectacular view from Bay side rooms”
Reviews.Author: asiantrekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom condo with a spectacular view of Biscayne Bay, palm trees and sailboats. Great location just steps from lively Coco Walk with its many nice shops and restaurants. The valet parking is very convenient and the service overall is courteous and efficient. The pool, hot tub and grounds are lovely and quiet in spite of their close location to a very busy (and noisy at night) road. The condo itself is rather small yet very nicely appointed with comfortable beds, high end linens and 2 flat screen TV's. The master bedroom has a huge walk-in closet with a safe. The unit also has a washer and dryer. The kitchen has the bare minimum utensils so don't plan on cooking anything elaborate. Atchana's restaurant off the lobby has nice Thai and western food with a limited menu.There is a great "Fresh Market" within walking distance. Our only complaint was the wifi which at best had a very low signal. The front desk was aware of the problem and said they were working on it. Overall, we would highly recommend the Mutiny Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secret in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: sailorjone
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mutiney during sailing regattas for the past 5 years. Perfect location, well maintained, beaurtiful suite style rooms with kitchen/living room along with washer dryer.... Reasonably priced, in house roomservice / restaurant and nicely appointed pool area - all facing Biscayne Bay and over looking a park. Highly recommend. Sailorjone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MollyScott
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in April before heading up to Orlando. This hotel was lovely we stayed in a suite which meant we had two bedrooms one with two single beds and one with a king size bed with an added walk in wardrobe. The sofa in the living area pulled out into a double bed which meant that it slept the five of us very comfortably. The balcony was just perfect it reached the full width of the suite which meant that you could sit out and watch the sunset and sunrise and it was overlooking the Marina. The taxis would pull up front and take you where bayside shopping centre was about 10 minutes in a taxi which had some lovely shops offering some boat trips to see some amazing house including celebrities. There was a cinema and restaurant complex about a 5 minute walk this included some chain restaurants like Chilli's, The Cheesecake Factory and Johnny Rockets. I will definitely be back next time we are in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, fun, perfect”
Reviews.Author: Angelinthesun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mutiny and totally enjoyed our sailing vacation. They staff was excellent! I recommend this location!

Reviews.Title: “large, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: yoshi808
Reviews.Content: Rooms are huge, fully equipped with kitchen & washer & dryer, & 2 flat screen tvs. Short walk to Coco Walk. Right across from marina & park.

Reviews.Title: “good place”
Reviews.Author: magicbullet058
Reviews.Content: You are in Coconut Grove, a very nice section of Miami. Less than 3 miles from the University of Miami and across the street from the marina. Three blocks away from the heart of Coconut Grove. The rooms are very big. They are clean and functional.The staff is pleasant. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful .... will return back.”
Reviews.Author: Lee007_11
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for a week. the hotel is located just 3-4 minutes away from coco walk. A great location. my room was very comfortable and spacious. i loved the balcony even though it faced the parking. friendly staff , nice swimming pool . The concierge was very resourceful and fast !!!! the bathroom could use some work though ( taps could be upgraded to work better ). nonetheless, i will surely return back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, close to all the action!”
Reviews.Author: Blondechickdublin
Reviews.Content: You could literally live at this hotel, washer & dryer fully equipped kitchen , great location , 2 min walk to coco walk! Go to green street restaurant for breakfast , great value for money !!

Reviews.Title: “Mutiny On Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: Jill K
Reviews.Content: The name of this Hotel says it all. WE JUMPED SHIP!!! This was to be a "special occasion" weekend and I made certain when booking the reservation months ahead, that the person in charge understood our desires. A Deluxe 1 Bedroom Suite was not close to DELUXE nor was it SWEET. I asked for one of the nicest rooms with updated bath and kitchen. I was told no problem. Needless to say the kitchen was dreary and the bathroom was absolutley non functional. There was no place to put your toiletries - I had to drag a chair and place it outside the bathroom door in order to have my supplies close by. The door was in the way of getting to the sink and the same held true for a bedroom closet - there was an end table in front of the closet door making it a chore to open. The mattress need replacing and the furniture was not at all what you would expect in an upscale, boutique hotel. The not so sweet suite had a good view but it was hard to get comfortable and had a sound system that had to be at least 20 years old along with 4 old channel changers to work it. Maybe it was this particular room/suite but even so, if these units are privately owned there should be a standard for the prices that are being charged. One another note...since we bailed out of there quickly, by accident, my husband left behind his cell phone plug and I can not find two garments I had with me when I unpacked....hmmm.... I called and spoke to security the following day to see if all was recovered. His reply to me was that we left the door open when we checked out,(which we did not) and that there were now other occupants in the room, therefore they could not get in to look. Between poor customer service, someone not being up front and an old place that needs updating there are certainly much nicer places in Coconut Grove to stay. I would never recommend this Hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Mutiny Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Mutiny Hotel. The hotel was beyond our expectations. The tile floors, the update bathrooms, the separate bedrooms, all were great. The staff was courteous and professional Staying the rooms was like living in your on condo. The location of the hotel which is a short walk from CoCoWalk in Coconut Grove is great. The view of the Bay is excellent as well as looking down on the parks with people enjoying from sunrise to sunset. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “STAFF STOLE ITEM & MANAGER IRRESPONSIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Ilianna
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed in this hotel. I was here on 11/11/11 for a wedding and reception and my iPhone was stolen. I believe it was stolen by an employee, especially because the wedding was small and everyone was friends and family; and also because my phone went straight to voicemail when we tried calling my number, even though my phone was on with enough battery when I last saw it. This indicates someone purposefully turned it off. When I spoke with the manager and suggested one of the employees took it, he suggested someone at the wedding took it. That was horrible customer service! The manager should have had hotel security search all employees. It's only right to give everyone fair warning about how this hotel operates. DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT SOMETHING STOLEN AND HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: Craig S
Reviews.Content: If you are vacationing in Miami with parents, grandparents, and children, staying at multi-rooms suite hotels along the beach is the only way to go. The cost per person is low and the views are fabulous. My son and his family including three of us grandparents loved our stay at the Mutiny Hotel with an 8th floor porch view of a boat harbor on Biscayne Bay. The Mutiny is in the Coconut Grove area of Miami. Restaurants and shopping are just around the corner. For you fans of the TV series, Burn Notice, the under-utilized Coconut Grove Convention Center that is now used as its film studio is just down the street. To get to the pool, you have to walk through a well-equipped fitness room. The Fort Lauderdale airport is a quick 30-mile trip on nearby I-95. This was our second stay in a Miami suite hotel. By now we wised up and used the full kitchen to fix dinner. After one-night stays in two different Miami suite hotels, none of us could clearly come up with a favorite. But we did agree that staying in suites was clearly nicer than renting three franchise motel rooms in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “These guys are the best....”
Reviews.Author: A S
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Mutiny for my brother's wedding, and all I can say is - WOW. The rooms were very nice, very clean, and certainly very spacious. The pool was perfect, and the Thai Restaurant downstairs is awesome. The best part about this Hotel though, is the customer service. These folks were outstanding. From Jesus in the bar to Claudia at the front desk, everybody was amazing. This staff was at our service, literally from the moment we walked in the front door until we left in the early hours of the morning four days later. I don't know that I've ever had a more courteous and responsive hotel staff, ever.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED AT”
Reviews.Author: virtualita
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for a month for work, in an apartment suite. This experience has been INCREDIBLY UNPLEASANT to say the least. The first room i got was on a low floor facing the back and was TOO NOISY (AC rattled throughout the night and trucks woke me up in the early morning) so i asked to be moved. The second suite did not have a washing machine, i was told that I HAD TO GO TO ANOTHER VACANT SUITE when i needed to to do my laundry (as if that's a favor), that "privilege" has since been revoked due to "security reasons" and i'm being forced to PAY FOR LAUNDRY SERVICE. There's the SUB-STANDARD HOUSEKEEPING, they only change sheets/towels, and take out garbage. There is dust everywhere and a smell from the carpet. Kitchen and bathroom have CABINET CRITTERS AND MILDEW STAINS everywhere from lack of proper cleaning. And finally, the HOSTESS AT RECEPTION thought it was appropriate to snap at me when i asked why I was not notified about a package delivery, lied to my face and said that it had only arrived an hour later (I had the confirmation emailed to me affirming that it had been delivered 6 hours earlier).

Reviews.Title: “amazing - great location”
Reviews.Author: keltoshe
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the mutiny in the late 80's. Came back June 2010 for a week after a cruise. Hotel staff fantastic, room fantastic location fantastic. Beats everywhere else in Miami hands down. I know brickal village is in right now, but the grove still makes for a great base. Easy to get to the port and airport. Sailboat bay views superb

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! A++++”
Reviews.Author: Egon S
Reviews.Content: I worked at this the hotel for two months, and the Front Desk, Concierge, Valet, Bellman, Security, and the office have been amazing. Working from the hotel I had to ask a lot from the entire staff at the Mutiny, and they attended to every single task that I've needed. Cheers to all!!! All the rooms we rented have unique quality with spacious living rooms and big kitchens, and all are furnished with formal dÃ©cor. Cleaning Service was great, whole place was spotless and they were attentive and helpful to some of our staff, whom have peculiar needs. Great location, beautiful Mayfair right behind the hotel and walking distance to Coco walk as well as all the bars and restaurants. Breath taking view from the room balcony. I wanted to give special thanks to all of the office staff including Claudia Cano and Jesus Montano for addressing all of our circumstances. The Front Desk staff Luis Rodriguez, Mario Leon, Yvonne Berga, and Isaura Parra for always extending a wonderful greeting and attending to our inquiries. The Concierge Ariel Cruz, and Karel Perez for helping answer all of our questions. The Bellman Alfredo Garcia, and David. Chief Engineer Ariel Paez for helping us with all our technical problems and boosting the internet. All of valet and all the security are extremely helpful. Great architecture, awesome service, great food, 5 stars in my book. I am impressed how well they took care of us at the Mutiny, and I will definitely come back here again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience!”
Reviews.Author: MizRite1130
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay at The Mutiny Hotel during the first week of June this year was excellent! Located in the heart of Coconut Grove, there were an abundance of shops, boutiques, and fine restaurants all within walking distance. The only complaint (and I wouldn't even call it a complaint) were the prices of the menu at the restaurant. Oh my goodness! My husband, son, and I ate breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, and to my surprise, our bill came to $72! Additionally, it was a hefty $21 per night to park at the hotel. But, those are very minor complaints considering our location. We had a blast there, and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Base for Exploring Miami”
Reviews.Author: ks404
Reviews.Content: Booked a 4 night stay here for our Miami visit, and very glad we did. I knew nothing of Miami, having never visited here before, so the options were many. The Mutiny proved to be a perfect place to stay. The place is spotless clean, silent at night, and the rooms are really apartments, with living rooms, a kitchen ,and bedrooms all in one. The staff were amazing in their attention to our needs, always asking if we needed anything and extending a greeting to us, often by name. The only thing that was not advertised is a $21 per day cost to valet park the car. That aside, it was nice to arrive each evening after dinner and have someone else park the car...a nice touch. I would stay here again when visiting Miami, as everything seemed close, especially good restaurants, amazing sites like the Biltmore and Venetian Pool, and both Coral Gables and Coconut Grove. I also feel we killed 'em for value by booking the advance payment option available on their website, which saved us at least 25% off the normal rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nice, nice!!!! Perfect for the price! More space for the money!”
Reviews.Author: PR-52
Reviews.Content: Very quiet hotel! The rooms a big and comfortable. The hotel is small but the rooms ar big. The pool is clean and the hotel too! I recommend! It's not a Ritz Carlton but you have more for your money than a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ! Modern convenience !”
Reviews.Author: miamiminnie
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Coconut Grove, within walking distance to shops and restaurants, this beautiful hotel was a sharp contrast to our usual expensive South Beach accomodations ! We enjoyed the modern facilities and reasonable cost, and the fact that we could walk to Biscayne Bay yet still be on Miami Beach within minutes.. the best of both worlds, with spacious facilities at the right price !

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE BEAUTIFUL LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Juan D
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a weekend g. The location is beautiful service was excellent. The staff is so nice. Best part of the room is it is an actaul apartment with full kitchensmy room was nice and clean. The restaraunt has great food i must say the breakfast was awesome. A must stay for all. it is located right nex to Cocowalk shopping complex.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the venue and service--would love to return!”
Reviews.Author: aeharrison
Reviews.Content: From when we first arrived to the day we left, everything was just wonderful. The staff, breakfast at the hotel's restaurant, location, room, I could go on and on...! The Mutiny Hotel is a beautiful hotel with luxurious rooms which include a kitchen with fridge and stove, living room, 2 tv's, walk in closet, bathroom and bedroom. The ambiance of the hotel is quite lovely and was perfect for my surprise getaway with my boyfriend! One thing I would say is that the bathroom didn't look like it had been swept very well, but other than that one tiny thing, everything was very clean and well managed. The location is also in close proximity (walking distance) to an outdoor mall with a couple stores, movie theater, cheesecake factory, chile's, bars and additional roads with stores all along the way. I had the best weekend there and hope to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: stamax
Reviews.Content: I just spent a most wonderful week at The Mutiny. As a native Miamian coming back to town on business, it was a place I was familiar with from it's beginning. The hotel has been beautifully updated and the one bedroom suite I occupied had ample space and was clean, comfortable, and homey. I was easily able to access the internet both in my room and poolside. Nothing like working by their pool in it's lush tropical setting. The feel is so intimate it seems like you are in the backyard you would like to have! But best of all, and most important of all was the staff. WOW! Kind, courteous, friendly and willing to do what they can to accommodate your needs. Oh, and I left out the most important quality of all...........HONEST! Upon returning to the hotel one evening, I inadvertently left my wallet in my car when I left it with their valet parkers. I didn't realize this till then next morning. Needless to say I was panic stricken. I called to the front desk and they had the car pulled up for me. I looked for it on the seats, under the seats, in the glove box... I found nothing. I returned to my room a bit depressed over my stupidity. Moments later, the phone rang to inform me that the valet manager had found the wallet between the door I hadn't opened and the seat. They brought it up to the room, not only was everything in the wallet, it hadn't even been opened. I can't tell you how relieved I was and how impressed by their care and concern. I am returning again in October with a group that is holding a huge fundraiser for Alzheimer's Disease. The Mutiny is our official hotel and one of the sponsors for our event. www.birdstock.info They deserve and have earned your business.

Reviews.Title: “good value for a suite”
Reviews.Author: cndnpride
Reviews.Content: After readying all the reviews we were very nervous about coming here. I will give you the good first. We ended up need a suite a day early and wow! they not only gave us a suite ...they gave us a discount. The first room over looked the dumpster...beautiful suite...but no thank you. We called down and the exceptional desk lad gave us our choice of three others. We took a suite that over looked the pool...not AS nice as the others..but very nice and clean and even the pull out was sleepable. The fabulous young man at the front dest was amazing. The resuturante food is fabulous. and it is soooooo easy to get in and out of the hotel to either walk up the block to all the resultants and shopping or to hit the highway and go to the jungle island or childrens museum or miami beach. Negative...it is a bit dated and the hallways smell like the sea...but we are literally right on the ocean. The gym in still underconstruction so you have to the hotel around the corner for the gym. we have been here for two nights and I have surgery here...I am very happy we choose this hotel. to get a full suite like this at any other hotel the prices were more than triple what they gave us here. I would come back....and Im a tough cookie to please! lol

Reviews.Title: “Fraud watch out!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: poopstainlane
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for one night and spent the night . When I got my Visa bill found out they billed me 3 days later for 162.00 for a nother night and I was 200 miles away When I called them they had no reason for the billing and said they will take the charge off so after i checked out 3 days later they pulled up my Visa number and hit it really????? whats up with this picture? My credit card co. called it Fraud! This use to be a nice hotel and I have spent a lot of time hear in the past 10 years. No more!!! The first room they put us in smelled like a big fat cigar and moved us to a room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in a walkable location”
Reviews.Author: pucgal
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location for walking access to Coconut Grove boutiques, restaurants, movies and even the Post Office. Our room was clean and ready for us upon check in. Since this is a condo hotel, our room had some issues. Maintenance did get our TV working, but lights, microwave etc. had to wait for another day to be fixed after our check out. The service in their small restaurant/bar is slow, but in spite of the limited menu, quite good. The staff was pleasant and the bellman/valet very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “The best service and quality!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessi33
Reviews.Content: Coconut Grove is a beautiful place to visit when your in Miami Fl and the best place to stay at hands down its the Mutiny Hotel. Theyre staff is always very helpful and go out of theyre way to accomodate you. The rooms are very clean and spacious. I would defenitly stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: OliveOil24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary. We stayed at The Mutiny and I would highly recommend it. The hotel is beautiful, modern yet very quaint and romantic. Once you enter, you forget that you are in Miami as tranquility sets in. The staff is just incredible and always went out of their way to make sure that our experience was just perfect. The location is incredible as you can spend some "quiet" time at the hotel and if you want to party , you can walk to the back of the hotel and be in the happening "CocoWalk" area. It was literally a five minute walk. We also enjoyed the restaurant in the hotel (Atchana's). The restaurant was amazing and the service impeccable. I would definitely go back to The Mutiny!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Josetimiraos
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here for more than 10 years and my experience always has been a very pleasant one. This hotel has charm and a very warm atmosphere. My room was recently remodeled and was stunning..! Next time you come to Miami be sure to stay here you will have an excellente experience..!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in an Ideal location, Miami”
Reviews.Author: charles033
Reviews.Content: The Mutiny Hotel is a delightful find for Miami where good service and good value are almost non existant. The Mutiny is located in Coconut Grove which is an ideal location just off US1 and is easily found. There are many boutiques and excellent reasaurants, and a good movie theater within walking distance. This all suite hotel has some very nicely appointed rooms, comfortable beds and well apointed unless you happen to get one at the rear side of the building which faces a parking garage, however all rooms have balconies and are spacious. The room service is good and it has a tiny but good part Thai restaurant adjacent to the lobby. The staff are cheerful and polite and are quite welcoming. This is a good place to stay as it is half way between downtown and the beach so everything is within reasonable reach.This is a perfect hotel to stay on business or pleasure and is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Krzysiek82
Reviews.Content: This was a last stop of my 1 month trip to the US and I couldn't ask for a better hotel. It's clean, greatly located and the staff is very helpful. My suite was comfortable, spacious, equipped with all necessary amenities and the view from the balcony is just fabulous. All of this at a very reasonable rate. Only thing I was surprised about was a lack of free wifi - strange since I've stayed at a cheap chain motels that had one.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great service,great staff”
Reviews.Author: duckworth02
Reviews.Content: Our family vacation was wonderful. The hotel was in a great location,fabulous views and fantastic service. The staff was most helpful with directions, dining advice, etc. We will definitely be staying at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific, relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: dbellis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mutiny because we wanted to avoid the loud and partying South Beach area. It was a perfect choice. The hotel sits across from the bay in quiet Coconut Grove but has easy access to the Miami Beaches, shopping and nightlife. You can easily walk to everything you need, including the wonderful Coco Walk, an area of top-notch resaurants, nightclubs, and shopping. We wanted to chill out and relax and it was just what the doctor ordered. The only thing we had a slight problem with was that the hotel was remodeling the room next to us and they started hammering and banging at 9:00am every day. Just a little annoying, but not enough to ruin things! I would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The Mutiny Resort”
Reviews.Author: j0rdant
Reviews.Content: Should be named the "Mutiny Resort". It truly has an atmosphere of a resort, not a hotel. The views are amazing of the bay. Service is excellent. Accomodations are great. It feels like you are included, not just visiting, in the local culture immediately after taking one short walk to view the bay or eat at the bayside resturant. Of course, with any business things can't be perfect in every way, but this sure is as close as I have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: Siara10
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the quiet ambience of the lobby with understated colors and elegant furnishings (reminds me of an established private country club), while the rooms were nicely spacious like a junior suite--kitchen, living room, separate bedroom, and bathroom. I also really liked the close proximity of the Coco Walk restaurant cluster that was a one to two minute walk going out the second floor exit door, yet you can't hear any of the activity at the restaurants at the hotel. They had many restaurant chains represented there: The Cheesecake Factory, Chilis, Hooters, while there were many other restaurants there, and along the streets. Lots of live music the evenings I was there and lots of people sitting outside enjoying themselves, people watching, etc. The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful, while one of the front desk clerks went out of her way to help me with my travel plans and retrieving my cell phone charger. She was very friendly and couldn't do enough to help me. I always like to stay in very nice resort hotels, while the customer service that I had received at The Mutiny Hotel was right up there with the Waldolf-Astoria hotel I had stayed in Boca Raton, Florida the two nights before.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: islndchcke
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and willing to help with any request we had. I stayed in a suite which was nice and spacious with a balcony. The bed was comfortable and I slept well. The suite had a kitchen with a full fridge which was great to keep the leftovers from dinner or bottled water. The staff at the bar was super friendly and was willing to whip up whatever drinks we desired. The pool area was nice and relaxing, not too noisy and very clean. The fitness center was fully equipped with all the essential machines and a sauna and steam room, which was helpful that I could keep up my workout routine even though I wasn't home. The Hotel is conveniently located next to the Cocowalk shopping/dining area which has a good variety of restaurants to choose from. It gets a little loud at night due to the music at Fat Tuesdays but it was fine. The only complaint I had which is very minor was that the AC unit located in the suite was very loud which was a bit startling the first night I tried to sleep but I got used to it. Overall Great Hotel I would definitely recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: cyrilbrunet
Reviews.Content: We have lived near to coconut groove during seven month, and our familly went to this hotel. We decided to return to this hotel, because the staff is very kind, smiling, always pleasant, even with the children. One of our children forgot one of these toys (a black panther), they sent us the toy in Europe. The children liked playing in the swimming pool. We had rented an apartment in the hotel (during 12 nights), what is more practical when we have children, because we can cook. The cleaning lady passed every day, bath towels was every day changed. It is the advantage of an apartment with the service of a hotel. I could go in for sport in the sporting room, which is equipped well + sauna. It is a very goog address.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: EPINCT
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the business or family traveler. The rooms are suites and having a kitchen can be convenient when on the road. The views are lovely, and sitting on the balcony with my computer was the best office I could ask for. Conveniently located in Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “The Mutiny was the perfect boutique hotel for our daughter's wedding weekend.”
Reviews.Author: SWAMia
Reviews.Content: Although we live in Miami we wanted all our out of town family and friends attending our daughter's wedding to stay at one convenient, attractive and intimate hotel. The Mutiny was the perfect choice. The group booking process was easy and well explained. The service was also very good although sometimes the reservation department was not as accommodating as they could have been when we asked to have some of our guests take the place of other guests who had to cancel their reservation in the final weeks. Overall, we were very pleased with the spacious, inviting rooms, the friendliness of the staff and the wonderful location in the heart of Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “My Best Weekend Of 2011”
Reviews.Author: Tonyr40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another close couple of ours wanted to celebrate our Anniversay in South Florida in our own "back Yard" and the Mutiny Hotal was the best choice we made what a pleasant weekend !!! the service was the best !!! and the hospitality made you feel your were at a World Class Resort. The location and views from the balcony is spectacular.....Best get away in the Groove

Reviews.Title: “still great after all these years”
Reviews.Author: dmty
Reviews.Content: We've been to Mutiny many times over the past 6 yrs and have found it to be consistently very good. Location can't be beat -- walk to the Grove with all its great restaurants, close to a great running park. Hotel is in very good shape, very clean, professional, friendly staff. Rooms are nicely appointed suites --clean & comfortable. Nice pool area which is completely enclosed with greenery giving sense of being isolated! Nice small restaurant with small bar on-site. Only complaint was that room we were in this time was above where all the dumpsters were located which meant couldn't sit on balcony due to odor. Although the dumpster area is enclosed they should consider having a roof over it to minimize the odor. This was only time this happened, but despite that we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Medicore at best”
Reviews.Author: nyctribecatraveler
Reviews.Content: I actually grew up in Miami and recently returned for a wedding. We were put up in the Mutiny Hotel in Coconut Grove and I have to say we were disappointed. While the rooms were spacious, bedroom, kitchen, living room, large closets and bathroom, they varied widely in terms of upkeep. Ours had relatively new furniture, but others had dirty furniture with stains and weird smells. As it is more of a long-term residence hotel, the service was atrocious. There was actually not one positive in the service at the hotel. We encountered rude housekeeping, valet, check in and front desk service. I know it is Miami (like I said I grew up there), but the English spoken by the concierge and check in desk was horrible! In one instance, they told my husband they were calling a cab for him and 30 minutes later when my husband checked in they said "oh yeah we couldn't get through." There is no laundry service on site and when my husband asked if there was someplace that could press his tux for the wedding, we were given a number for a local drycleaning store - that was out of service! When we asked for brunch recommendations, the concierge said that "there were good options - just walk around." As well, our room was next to a taller condo that had lights on all night and there were not curtains to block out the light. So at night when we were trying to sleep, our whole bedroom was flooded with light. The windows were also thin and you could completely hear people's conversation on the ground outside our window. The pool is small and shaded as well. There are many other options nearby (the Ritz, the Sonesta, even the Courtyard Marriott) that would serve you better and provide the same good location. I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GroveFan63
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my family (2 Adults, 2 Teenagers) through the end of February, early March. We stayed in one of the upper floor front units (the x01 and x02 units). Great sunrises and sunset views! Superb location for those who want to be close to where the action is (SoBe, Coral Gables, Downtown) but get away as easily when things get too crowded. Shopping and Restaurants nearby, actually, walking distance (not so common elsewhere in Miami!). Family will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: maf908285
Reviews.Content: This place was a nice hotel in Coconut Grove. It is a little dated (they still use actual keys), but it's also a good price. The rooms were clean and the pool was nice. Although the cocktail service at the pool was painfully slow. The rooms could definitely be updated, but on the positive side our standard room had a full kitchen and a washer/dryer - so it would probably be a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: daddenburgh
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Mutiny in mid february 2011. Here is a list of my pros and cons Pros: Adequate fitness center ,great sauna/steam room Friendly and polite staff 3 minute walk to Cocowalk area/ multiple restaurants/ couple of great outdoor breakfast spots 5 minute walk to a gourmet market called Fresh Market Pool area had good sun exposure Cons: Although the lobby and the downstairs were very well appointed, the upstairs needed some updating. The concierge was never at the desk You will need a car if you want to go to the beach $13/day charge for WiFi Would definately recommend to a friend and will probably stay again next year

Reviews.Title: “Dated”
Reviews.Author: doctorrod
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 2 nights at the Mutiny. To the positives: good location , roomy and clean accommodations. To the negatives:this hotel looks dated. I bet you it has not been refurbished in a long time and it shows. For the price in Miami, this is not acceptable. For around the same price, next-door, the Sonesta is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate to Outstanding (You be the judge)”
Reviews.Author: wclaar
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a mixture of adequate to outstanding during our 8 day stay in Coconut Grove. The view from our room (602) was outstanding overlooking the bay and Myers/Peacock Park bordering Biscayne Bay. The room was very comfortable and spacious fully furnished with two bedrooms, two full baths a full kitchen. Most of the fixtures, furniture were worn and in some cases outdated. Several wall electrical outlets did not work. Interior paint, trim and walls lacked any attention to detail, closet doors had excessive coatings of paint and should be replaced. All plumbing fixtures turn the wrong direction are old,worn and clogged. Toilets are difficult to flush and are in need of maintenance. The staff was very responsive when tips were plentiful. Internet costs if you want to use it in the convenience of your room and parking will cost you $21.00 per day. Don't look for too much value past the room and view.

Reviews.Title: “Location and creature comforts”
Reviews.Author: Liz34179
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mutiny for 2 nights in a 2BD/2BA suite. We had to be in the area for day surgery at a nearby facility. Our suite was wonderful with every convenience including a full kitchen and a W/D in the suite. The staff could not do enough for us. We had no idea how perfect the location is - walking distance to waterfront restaurants and a wonderful gourmet supermarket. And right around the corner are all the shops and restaurants of Coconut Grove. The condo/hotel has a lovely pool area and an adequate gym. There is a 24 HR Fitness within a couple of blocks if you want more exercise options. There is a really cute little restaurant in the hotel as well. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Choice in Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: Fastsailor
Reviews.Content: We have journeyed to Coconut Grove more than a dozen times in the last ten years and stayed at four different hotels. This year marked our eighth stay at the Mutiny for the Orange Bowl International Youth Regatta. Our family stayed for two weeks and my older son and I stayed on for the Orange Bowl football game. We have always enjoyed the Mutiny's proximity to both the sailing venues and the Coconut Grove amenities but this year we were pleasantly surprised by the extensive room rennovations , including flat screen TVs and new furnishings. Also for our family, the full kitchen and in-room washer / dryer is a must. The friendly staff, great location, spacious suites and in-room amenities make this the hands down choice in Coconut Grove.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: sail02025
Reviews.Content: really terrific place to stay with teenagers - central to everything, fabulous service and staff - especially claudia!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable suites in great location”
Reviews.Author: meh2
Reviews.Content: I was quite impressed by the Mutiny - the Mutiny is almost more like a condo building with the added bonus that they tailor to an upscale crowd in Cocunt Grove. It is right by the water and a shopping mall that is really trendy and distinctively Coconut Grove. The rooms are very clean, I understand that they all have kitchens in them and some rooms have a porch as well. I wish the WiFi internet was free, but they do charge $10 daily as well the valet service is around $15 daily too I believe. If you stay here, make sure to get a room away from the rear of the building near the garage as it tends to be louder due to the movement of the cars and there is not much view from the windows. Ask for a room with a high floor and as close to the front as possible to get a bay view and you wil lbe happiest...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of housekeepers”
Reviews.Author: gat0rm0m
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location with close access to Coconut Grove. Had large party with multiple rooms and stayed over several days. Each party had different quality room which varied from excellent (marble floors and fancy bath and kitchen) to beat up minimally furnished rooms. Desk service, restaurant and pool were all great. I had large problem with housekeepers who left any stray clothing inside bidet! Also happened to leave 4 articles of clothing in room when checked out which had 'disappeared' by the time I called (my bad but....).

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: canespe
Reviews.Content: My husband & I traveled with our 17 year old son to Miami for UM's Homecoming weekend (11/5-11/8/10). We stayed at the Mutiny because it was located in Coconut Grove and the rooms were listed as suites. The one bedroom 'suite' we got was smaller than some hotel rooms. We had a full-size bed in a room with only a nightstand - no room for a dresser or chair or anywhere (but the closet) to put our stuff. The living area had a huge kitchen table and a sleep sofa. But had a big square entertainment table in the middle to put the little flat screen t.v. on. Better use of space would have been to put the t.v. on the wall. Sleep sofa had old sheets on it - nasty. No chairs to sit on except for 3 kitchen chairs that only could fit at the table. The chairs were metal scraping on the tile floor. Kitchen was ok - no dish soap to clean dishes. The cold water handles to the faucets in the bathroom were not attached to the sink or bath tub. There was not a fan in bathroom either. In the bedroom there was not a vent for ac - so we had to prop open the door to get air which defeated the reason for booking a suite, so that my son could stay up and watch t.v. The hotel was full so we could not move. Valet parking was $21.00 per day. Charged for internet. Didn't have bill ready on check-out even though I spoke with front desk the night before. Wedding there on Saturday - took up pool area and lobby. The hotel has apartments - lots of people with dogs - one even humped my leg. The hotel could be okay if before you accepted a room - to go look at it before. Typically I do not put up with problems, but my son had a meeting at UM and we were in a rush to shower and get to the school. The 'business center' computer was slow and the printer did not work - free to print boarding passes, but costs if you need to do anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location rooms are not the ones you see on the website”
Reviews.Author: denningr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days with my family. Fantastic location, very good service and the food was excellent. Few things to note. The rooms are not as shown online. The rooms are being upgraded and only a few have been done. The room we stayed in was ok but tired and the AC was very noisy. Finally the sofabed was uncomfortable. Having said that the rooms are large and spacious, clean and the staff are excellent. For Miami it is reasonable value. Once the rooms have been refurbished it will be an amazing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable, yet elegant hotel I have experienced in quite some time.”
Reviews.Author: caroleKendal
Reviews.Content: The quiet comfortable surroundings of this elegant hotel had all the amenities I desired and more. From the moment I drove to the front of the hotel through my entire stay all the service personel were attentive, warm and inviting. The front desk staff were concerned that all my needs would be met and anything they could do to insure my stay was memorable one would be insured. Once I was inside my room I was pleasantly surprised with its elegant decor and the bucolic view of the boats on the water and lush green plantings around the property. The luxurious bedding and the superior quality of the towels were appreciated and kitchen area was supplied with all one could possibily want. The hotel was in a perfect location with restaurants and shopping in close proximity. The most outstanding memory was the clean, comfortable room followed closely by the staff, especially the general manager. This hotel is definitely a hidden jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Hit the Spot”
Reviews.Author: CecilyVan
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was just what I needed to provide my client with a relaxing yet top-notch stay in Miami. It's in the heart of Coconut Grove and within many interesting locales, so my client had a wonderful time in Miami. The room I was in was a suite with a full kitchen. Everything is updated with a modern edge, which I like. The staff was professional, and saw to it that my client received excellent treatment throughout her stay. I will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Security at the Mutiny made my entire week”
Reviews.Author: thethirdclyde
Reviews.Content: My ID, insurance, and other important items were in a leather slip in my wallet, which somehow fell out on on Thursday night. I spent all of Friday calling every single place I had been and re-walking my steps. After talking to the security at the Mutiny on Friday to no avail, somehow on Saturday they found it for me. Literally would have ruined my month but they worked hard and found my ID for me. I don't know what I would have done with out them! The rest of the staff at the Mutiny were tremendously helpful also I couldn't imagine a better group of people ever.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a get away!”
Reviews.Author: 11hello
Reviews.Content: The best part about staying at the Mutiny hotel is the location. Not only do you have a great view of the water from the hotel but many stores & restaurants are in waliking distance and the atmosphere is great. The hospitaility that was demonstrated by the hotel employees was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: sweetrelief
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Mutiny Hotel on the Bay for the first time after cancelling reservations at another hotel in Coconut Grove. We absolutely loved the hotel and everything about it from the tropical pool, alcove bar, view and the luxuious suite. The suite was beautifully decorated with every amenity and a capitivating view of Sailboat Bay. I spent every morning, sipping coffee and watching the sun rise over the sailboats. I have never felt so relaxed. As wonderful as the accommodations were, the staff was even more so. The valet, desk clerk, concierge and bellman all called me by name whenever I came through the lobby or needed their service. We have never felt more taken care of and welcomed. This was a girls retreat and we will be coming back again and again. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the Grove!”
Reviews.Author: honcho50
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mutiny twice in the last two months and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The location in the heart of Coconut Grove was perfect for driving anywhere in Miami. You can walk to restaurants, shops, parks and a gourmet supermarket is a short ride away. The Mutiny has an â€œold worldâ€� atmosphere and if you're looking for a comfortable and quiet place then the Mutiny is worth considering. It's so convenient to have a well-equipped kitchen and laundry in the room and while there is no premium cable service the price was just right. The fitness and business centers are modest but well equipped. Maintenance personnel were quick to respond to calls and staff was very courteous and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: maderpint
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, have been going to the Mutiny since 2005 and is a great value, rooms are very well appointed and clean and have a great view. The pool is very nice and the restaurant is ok. Staff is very good Ysaura was very nice. The price of the valet parking is 21 per day but if you ask at the front desk they can lower it to 16. Airconditioner in our room was very noisy but we didn't care because all of the other features of the hotel and rooms are great for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: familiahenderson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mutiny from July 30 to Aug 4 2010 and had a great time. The rooms were clean, staff was friendly and very professional. We had left our video camera in the room and it was reported and mailed to us in a day! Now that is outstanding.... the staff is honest and willing to go out their way to make sure you leave with everything you came with. We will be staying at the Mutiny anytime we go to Miami, it is now our official home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Great pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: honeya
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mutiny Hotel one night before my seven day cruise. It was my first time on a cruise and I was sooo excited! I was even more excited to see that this junior suite was just right for our stay. We walked to the shops right across the street and even walked allll the way down to the CVS! Stopped by an antiques shop, can't remember the owners names, but they were awesome! Things were under construction... so it was a little dusty.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER - July 4th Fireworks at the Mutiny - BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: mojoeking
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Mutiny is definitely a hidden secret that wont be for long. The accomodations, amenities and location make it such a nice change of pace from typical hotels. the rooms are huge compared to a hotel and the full size fridge, stove and dishes are a well thought of bonus. The view for the Fireworks overlooking Peacock Park were amazing and cant be beat. The staff (Sylvia) and the entire front desk staff were very professional, efficient and always helpful. I just felt bad for the attendants left to clean up after a fun filled weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pink883
Reviews.Content: Our girls trip was enhanced by the staff t the Mutiny. They couldn't have been more sincere, friendly, or helpful. The hotel was clean, the pool was lovely. Thank you for such a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Mutiny is a fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: moiaya
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Mutiny several times and love it. It's so nice to have a kitchen and laundry in the room. The location is wonderful, across from the water, and just a short walk to shopping. The pool area is comfortable and nice. Room service is good. Customer service is good. The rooms are clean with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome accommodations, excellent service & beautiful views.”
Reviews.Author: foxtrotr
Reviews.Content: From the moment we rolled onto the brick pavers of the Mutiny's entrance, we felt like we'd arrived someplace special. Excellent service started the moment our car doors opened! The Mutiny has managed to combine elegant accommodations with warm friendly service, even for a family of five! Traveling with two teens and a ten year old, we were really impressed by our suite. A large master with a big comfortable bed, and a large walk in bathroom! The master and the living room had spectacular views of the bay. The kids had their own room, and their own bathroom! When traveling with children there are a few key words that can really make your trip more convenient and enjoyable: washer & dryer, kitchenette, extra closet space. The Mutiny provided all of this in a setting that has more than enough charm for a family, and is well suited for a romantic get-away. The central location in the heart of Coconut Grove was perfect for driving anywhere in Miami. Just outside the hotel we could walk to restaurants, parks, shops, and even a gourmet supermarket!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Memorial Day Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Memorial052010
Reviews.Content: The staff was courteous, and addressed us on the telephone as 'Mr. Grover'. Maintenance personnel were quick to respond, and understood the equipment in the room. We stayed only two nights, so we can't comment on the cleaning staff. Suffice it to say, the room was very clean when we checked in. The bed was very comfortable. Finally, there was no audible noise from adjacent rooms; it was very quiet in the room. Parking options were not sufficiently explained to us by the Front Desk. There is a parking garage adjacent to the hotel that is shared with the hotel valet parking. We were informed by a non-hotel parking attendant that a $15 voucher can be issued by the hotel for overnight parking; this was not told to us by the Front Desk. The room; we stayed in two rooms. The first room was unacceptable; the oven did not function, and the air conditioning did not function. Maintenance was quick to reply; they assessed the problems, and we were quickly assigned to a new, 'better' room. The second room was nice. The room was more towards the front of the building, and the view of Biscayne Bay was great. We were higher up on the 8th floor, and it felt more elegant. The furniture was newer than the first room, and was more comfortable. However, we have a few comments, which basically apply to both rooms: 1. The televisions are very small compared to today's standards. A 13" television in the bedroom? A 13" television is good for the kitchen, or the bathroom. 2. There was only one DVD player, not in the Bedroom, but in the Living Room. The DVD player was not connected to the television; we had to connect the wires ourselves. 3. The (small) television in the Living Room was located on one end of the space; the sofa was located on the other end of the space. We had to rearrange furniture accordingly. 4. There was no premium cable service in either of the two rooms we stayed in. 5. Batteries for remotes were old; we had to call Maintenance for replacements. Our stay was pleasant, and we would attend again. Thank you for a wonderful Memorial Day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: JDG1234
Reviews.Content: I took a short term residence at The Mutiny Hotel during construction was being done on my home. The staff has been extremely accommodating to both myself and my 11 yr old dog. The location is the best in the Grove and the views can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: kdean1234
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at the Mutiny and I must say it is a first rate hotel. I had never been here and was pleasantly surprised with the level of services, quality of rooms and cleanliness and comfort. This would also be a nice vacation spot or get-a-way weekend spot as well. Cheers to the staff and management for a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Unique Wedding Guest and vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BocaBeth
Reviews.Content: The Mutiny Hotel of Coconut Grove Florida is the best, most unique hotel to entertain wedding guests, have wedding events and vacation. The staff is extremely attentive to your every needs, the hotel rooms/units are fabulously unique and well appointed. The hotel restaurant Atchana's has a delightful extremly professional staff, a fabulous menu as well as the ability to accomodate our culinary requests not on the menu, and the owner Atchana ran our events flawlessly. Scott MacAbee, Director of Sales and Marketing coordinated the rooms/unitswith the guests to accommodate their wants and needs, as well as my many stays at the hotel while cordinating the wedding arrangments. My wedding event guests fell in love with the hotel and are planning to return for future vacatons. I also stayed at the hotel for vacation and relaxation which was fabulous in every way. The tropical pool setting is a unique and delightful. If you are planning a wedding, event or a vacation I would reccomend that you consider the Mutiny, you will be so very pleased with the outcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spacious Rooms and Gorgeous Bay View!”
Reviews.Author: apuente22
Reviews.Content: Our business recently hosted a large event, and we booked our guests at the Mutiny. Their service is excellent, and the rooms are even better. We booked several 1 bedroom suites, and the price was just right. The rooms had gorgeous bay views, kitchen, and it was walking Distance from Cocowalk. I highly recommend this for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “We very much enjoyed the Mutiny Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UnofficialPalladium
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited the U of Miami recently for a tour. Through their site we discovered the Mutiny Hotel in the heart of Coconut Grove. This is a small, 12 story building overlook an attractive park and Sailboat Bay. It is an easy taxi ride from Miami airport and the U of Miami. Tastefully decorated in a tropical British style, it consists of 1 and 2 bedroom suites. When we travel we prefer suites as we have different waking and sleep schedules and enjoy having a kitchen available. We had a beautifully appointed master bedroom with a very comfortable king bed, a living room with a sleep sofa, sitting area, balcony and fully furnished kitchen. The suite was immaculate. We were also provided fluffy white towels, robes, coffee pot and coffee, a newspaper, wireless internet, toiletries, a hair dryer, and more. The hotel has a beautifully landscaped pool area where one can have a leisurely breakfast. There is also a small and charming restaurant on site. The hotel is an easy stroll to Coco Walk and its many shops and restaurants. It is a delightful and colorful area. I felt perfectly safe allowing my daughter to go out and meet friends nearby. Staff were very helpful and knowledgeable. We were welcomed back and told that if my daughter attends the U of Miami, we can obtain a corporate discount. We surely will be back! My only suggestion would be for the hotel to offer morning coffee in the lobby. I didnâ€™t want to arouse my daughter by making coffee in the room so instead wandered out to a nearby cafÃ©. Not a complaint, just a suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended . . .”
Reviews.Author: linda_coder
Reviews.Content: Newly Renovated. Excellent Staff, Accommodations, Service.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: JJsmithjr
Reviews.Content: I need to say that I had such a great time with my friends at this hotel. From the moment we arrived to the day we left was just great!. The room was a very good with a great view of bay. Kitchen was very organized. I had a small issue with closet door, but was fixed in no time. Valet staff was very friendly and front desk was attentive and made me feel very special. I ll definetely come back and stay in their deluxe suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: QuailOxford
Reviews.Content: Having just spent 4 nights in the hotel I feel that potential travellers should be warned that the experience has been very poor - the 'Junior Suite' that was booked to acommodate 4 people "in two rooms" turned out to be a 'suite' comprising a bedroom with the second 'bed' being an old sofa bed pulled out in the kitchen/diner. Maybe ok for a child at a push but certainly not ok for adults. The first room was filthy (714) with unwashed crockery and mould around the taps but the room we moved to (614) was a little better. The poor accomodation aside, the desk staff managed to screw up a car rental booking with the day staff denying all knowledge of the booking that had been made by the evening staff (despite having a reference number that they gave us). Only one girl on reception had any clue, the rest were breathtakingly useless. Overall, don't be fooled by the pictures on the web site - the areas downstairs are fine but the accommodation is poor. For the price, you may wish to accept this, but don't expect much for your money.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Druxys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tired - lobby area is fine but the rooms are tired and in need of a face lift. We looked at a parking garage and were disturbed a few times during the night by car alarms. The bathrooms aren't very nice. We did a load of laundry that was ruined by bleach - someone had put bleach in either the washer or dryer and our entire load was ruined. Coconut Grove isn't the vibrant area it used to be. Overall, it was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel for a great rate.”
Reviews.Author: scienceteacher818
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended - friendly staff, nice gym and pool. The room was clean and the rates were very reasonable. We stayed in a suite with a kitchen. It was perfect for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, top-notch accommodations”
Reviews.Author: paulajoMissouri
Reviews.Content: We arrived a little early but they allowed us to check in anyway. Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had a suite with a king size bed. The front desk staff was courteous and always helpful. The concierge was extremely kind and assisted us in making shuttle reservations to the airport. Just out the back door on ground floor and through the parking garage is Coco Walk, a wonderful area with shopping, dining and entertainment, all withun walking distance. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miztraveller
Reviews.Content: Only stayed 2 nights here en-route to the floriday keys but would be happy to recommend this to other travellers. Nice big Appt style rooms, 2 x bathrooms, king size bedroom and double sofa bed for kids. Quite situation but only 5 mins walk to Coco Walk which has cinema/restaurants/shops etc. Pool very nice with jacuzzi. Valet parking only which bumps the price up but still reasonable for miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good as always”
Reviews.Author: roady00
Reviews.Content: Had a nice time at The Mutiny last May. A spacious and comfortable 1-bedroom apartment, nice and attentive staff, good location and a fair price. Nothing to complain at all!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and good location to downtown Coconut Grove”
Reviews.Author: spoons99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Mutiny hotel for a friends wedding in early april. This was the designated hotel for out of town guests.Overall, it was a very nice hotel, and reasonably priced due to the Wedding rate. In the specturm of the hotels in the Coconut grove area, it sseemed to be in the middle (There is a Ritz-Carlton nearby and also a Hampton Inn). The hotel appears to be an old Condo building that was refurbished to a hotel. My wife and I stayed in a normal room, and it came with a double bed, which is quite small. The room has a large bathroom with a bidet?!, kitchenette and livingroom. The room served its purpose and the decor was good. The room was clean overall, and the air-conditioning worked great, which is important in Miami. The hotel has an outdoor pool on the ground floor, which was good, as well as a hot tub. Very nice features. The hotel is also about 3 blocks from the heart of downtown Coconut Grove, which is a nice little town in Miami, which shops, restaurants and bars. Overall, if you get a good rate, I would recommend thi hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Farodivers
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to coco walk - shopping and to great bars and restaurants. The room was nice, we got a studio w/ kitchen and living room. The bed was very small but comfortable. Great shower. Parking fee of $20 a day - valet . The only problem I had there was that I had payed - through Hotwire - for an extra day, so that I could leave late without having to ask for a late checkout and maybe change rooms. When I told the girl in the front desk, she said that I couldnt do that (leave earlier). I tried to explain that I was paying more so that I could stay as long as I wanted but she just didnt get it. I actually had to argue with her and that was not very nice. How can I not be able to leave one day earlier than I payed for? Maybe she thought I wanted my money back - but I never said that. Anyways...

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back to the Mutiny - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MadelineNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The Mutiny is a beautiful all suite hotel. Excellent customer service, great location within walking distance of a great grocery store - Fresh Market & within walking distance of a great local waterfront restaraunt/bar Scottys. Our room was very clean & comfortable. Great views from every room & a nice balcony. There are lots of amenities, most notably the pool area was adorable & inviting. The value at the Mutiny is commendable - we paid just $129/night. An excellent price for what you get. I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: nphoenix
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on business recently for a few days. Internet was not working and the staff refered me to an 800 number to some call center who spends an hour troubleshooting and then concludes the wireless routers are down and he would call the front desk to get them rebooted... it never happened over several days. Fortunally if i sat on the bed i could get 1 bar signal from the nearby public library. The first morning the shower faucet broke off turning off the water. With water gushing I phoned the front desk - NO ONE EVER CAME UP and 2 hours later i used some kitchen utensils to turn down the rate of flow in time to get my breakfast delivered 7:20 for a 7am. The faucet was fixed by afternoon. Running the AC was a good way to aviod sleeping as it delivers many decibles into the entire room. Also check your bill as i was double billed for breakfast and they retained internet charges. Staff is completely indifferent to any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: 610cheri
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a wonderful location, overlooking Biscayne Bay and walking distance to all that Coconut Grove has to offer. The accommodations were also exceptional. Having a two bedroom, two bath apartment with a full kitchen was very comfortable for our family of six. (Although the sleep sofa was not the most comfortable.) The view from our balconies was amazing. On the down side, it took four requests from the desk to get the extra towels we needed. Also, housekeeping could have been more thorough. The light fixtures in the bathrooms were "fuzzy" and it would be nice if the hotel could provide better pillows. But I would not hesitate to recommend the Mutiny to friends and I'd love to go again!

Reviews.Title: “dishonest booking”
Reviews.Author: murphy45
Reviews.Content: Made reservations in December for a two night stay in March. Got a phone call while traveling to Miami telling us that the Mutiny had moved us to a "comparable" room at the Doubletree due to unexpected bookings. We had booked a suite with a kitchen at the Mutiny - at the Doubletree, we got only a room (not even a refrigerator), so not comparable, but we had to pay the same price as original booking. The manager at the Mutiny basically stonewalled any arguments we tried to make concerning our situation. Said we could have a complimentary night at some time in the future. Who would want to take the chance on booking them again? Definitely not us. We felt that this overbooking situation was not unusual for the Mutiny and that their honesty should be questioned.

Reviews.Title: “2-star quality at 4-star price”
Reviews.Author: Prasdaddy
Reviews.Content: Pro: Excellent Location that is a quick drive to downtown Miami and 2 minutes to CocoWalk shopping/dining/entertainment area. Comfortable rooms with North/South views that have the bayfront along the Eastern aspect. The front desk staff is generally pleasant. Con: Overpriced. very limited guest ammenities. Fitness center is very small with outdated equipment. Concierges generally uninformed and with poor customer service. "Business center" consists of one small computer and desk inside a room that is about 30 sq. feet (smaller than a standard cell).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fsu8503
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mutiny the last week of June. It is about a 20 minute drive from MIA. The location is one the water in Coconut Grove and has decent views of Biscayne Bay. The hotel is located with a couple minutes walking distance of Coco Walk which is a nice collection of shops and restaurants. The hotel was gorgeous when we walked up. You have to valet which is about $10 a day. We got to the rooms and they were nice. All rooms are suite style. They were pretty clean, though aged. Most are individually owned and rented when not in use. All of them had stoves, microwaves and fridges. This was nice as there is a Publix about 10 minutes north and we all purchases breakfast items to save time. The workout room was decent. A number of differnet options. The highspeed internet option is about the same as usual - $10 per day. There was a bar and restaurant attached to the hotel that were pretty nice. All in all, if I got a decent rate I would stay there again. It is quiet and out of the downtown-ness of Miami, but close enough that it's only 10 minutes to Miami and 20 to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: shellyleyva
Reviews.Content: Not a great place. Horrible beds, dirty dishes, rat poop on the floor. I was told there was a beach across the street. It was a harbor for docking boats. The front desk staff was rude. We walked in to a half roll of toilet paper and there was not another roll to be found. We had to use kleenex we had taken from our previous hotel. We were supposed to stay 2 nights but I was so horrified after the first hour I made arrangements to leave the next morning. If you like expensive shops this is a good place as the coco walk is right behind the hotel and since we were on the eight floor we did have an excellent view but I would definitely not stay here again. Yuck

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff and Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: augustojr
Reviews.Content: Booked a 3-night stay through Hotwire four months before visiting for U of M graduation. Arrived at 7pm Thurs. and was told by the front desk clerk, while he was on the phone, that they were overbooked. No one called to let me know in advance even though they had my contact information. He said the Mutiny would pay for us to stay at a nearby hotel for the night and to walk there (no offer for help with luggage). He said to come back in the morning and promised there would be a room the next night since I had prepaid reservations and they had to accommodate us. When we got to the nearby hotel there were 4 other guests from the Mutiny that were sent there too. At 8am the next morning we went back and a different front desk clerk said they were still overbooked so we would have to stay at the nearby hotel again for that night. I asked for more information but he dismissed me and said the nearby hotel had all the information that I needed. Again no phone call was made to let me know there was no room available for that night's stay; I only found out when I returned to check in person. The next morning was the last day of my reservation so instead of walking there in the heat I called to check. A different front desk clerk answered and said she didn't know anything about my situation, so I explained and she said she would have to check with the manager and someone would call me back. An hour and a half later I called back to get an update and the same clerk said they were still 'working on it' and that someone would definitely call me back before I had to check out of the nearby hotel for the day. Half an hour before checkout time I called again and she said they 'hadn't forgotten about me' but that they were still checking and would definitely call me back. I had to ask the nearby hotel for late checkout because the Mutiny still didn't have an answer for me. The 4th time I called I was finally given a manager to talk to who said he didn't know anything about my situation and he said he would look into it and call me back. I told him I had heard that before and he said that I hadn't spoken to him before so I should expect a callback from him in 5 minutes. He called back 10 minutes later and said to checkout of the nearby hotel and walk to the Mutiny, and things would be sorted out when I arrived. I told him I would rather know if I had a room before carrying my luggage over there. He said the Mutiny had other guests that were sent to other hotels because of the overbooking and that I was â€˜luckyâ€™ because some of them were sent to hotels closer to the airport, and I should be grateful that I was within walking distance. When I finally did get a room, the bedding was torn, stained and worn, the pillows were thin and yellowed and the curtains were ripped. The closet door couldn't be opened all the way because the nightstand was in the way. The furniture layout was crowded and cramped. Fortunately the bathroom was clean and had nice toiletries. When I checked out the next morning the front desk clerk refused to give me a receipt since the room was prepaid and there were no new charges. I asked him for one anyway and he said there was no point since it would have no balance and he walked away. There was no offer to help me with luggage and no offer to call for a taxi. The best part of my experience with the Mutiny was the first two nights at the beautiful nearby hotel that they paid for (since they didn't offer me any other kind of compensation). Thanks Mutiny!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST CHRISTMAS EVER***** BEST PLACE TO STAY *******”
Reviews.Author: sabre001
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to wright this beucase it was one of my best stays ever. I nneded to get away for the holidays, while i was looking around i found this nice quiet tucked away place outside the ordinary.. I wanted to spend a special time with my family during the holidays and i said let me take a chance. And let me tell you from check in to check out the staff, restaurant and Valet treated me like if this was HOME... The hotel decorations were put beautyfully , everyone was in the christmas spirit. The restaurant was on the money from the food to the serivce. SO I RECOMMED THE MUTINY HOTEL IN COCONUT GROVE. The rooms were wonderful and the view to die for very relaxing and romantic..... Congrats Mutiny Hotel Excellent Job.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: CelebrationFleecer
Reviews.Content: The "hotel" (condo-tel) is in a good location and service is decent (except for the valet). Unfortunately I have nothing else nice to say about the hotel. The room was not clean (hair in the bathroom, dirt all over the furniture). However, the worst part was the noise at night. When we checked in the room was quiet. When we returned to the room for the evening the permanent resident in the condo next to our bedroom left his/her surround sound system on all night. I don't know if the walls are thin or if that resident is just downright inconsiderate, but we were not able to sleep that night. Checking out was the best part of our stay. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone that I liked and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mickey1000
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservations through Orbitz. The reviews seemed to be good and I had heard great things from family member who stayed here earlier this year.
