I received an awesome deal, or so I thought. The hotel is in a great location near the grove. However, we were given the very last room in the back of the hotel facing the parking garage. Though there wasn't much of a view I can accept it for the price I paid. What was unacceptable was the ordor in the bedroom. It smelled like wet towels. We called the front desk and they changed the sheets on the bed and cleaned the suite again. The next day they brought up a machine to help take the ordor out of the room. It improved however the next day it still had that foul ordor. They came in and sprayed the unit. We had requested to move if they ordor continued but our request in that regard was ignored. I traveled with my mother and gave her the bedroom and I stayed on the sofa bed couch. It was not very comfortable. Another problem is that you could hear everything in the room next to us or so I thought, my mother believes someone came into our room. I heard foot steps about 3 in the morning which I thought came from next door, however my mother believes they came into our room. Also, one afternoon we went out, upon our arrival as we got off the elevator we saw the housekeeping and front desk clerk attempting to enter our room. When they saw us coming up I let them know that we were in that room they said they were coming to check on us and see if we needed anything. When they left I found our balcany door open, I had closed the door before I had left so I just figured they were up to something out there, they never mentioned it though. Anyway, this place left a bad taste in my mouth and I will not be returning and cannot recommend it to any one else.

Reviews.Title: “Mutiny Hotel /Miami Condo 0asis - My Jewel L.L.C.”
Reviews.Author: sailfamily4
Reviews.Content: Beware of this condo owner, who goes by Miami Condo Oasis at the Mutiny Hotel in Coconut Grove, Florida. We stayed at the Mutiny during December, 2005. The unit was very nice , Check-in was a breeze. However like other posts he kept our deposit and after many excuses never returned our $500! I would NOT use this unit. I would contact the hotel directly and pay more and avoid this person.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tin509
Reviews.Content: Wonderful!! I can not say one negative thing about the Mutiny. It was fabulous. The lobby, exterior/grounds, pool area and bar area was beautiful, very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. The entire property was very clean, modern and welcoming. Our one bdrm was gorgeous. Very modern furnishings and decor. Close to everything (shops, Coco walk etc.) My girlfriends and I absolutely loved the Mutiny and will always stay at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Condo Oasis--Myjewell, LLC--Beware of this Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In April of 2006, my wife and two grandchildren used the Miami Condo Oasis unit for four days. I had won the use of it at a charitable auction. I sent in the required application and a $250 deposit through Pay Pal. In addition, I had to pay $95 to have the place cleaned before we could use it. As of this date, July 10th, the deposit nor the cleaning fee have not been returned, and I can not get a response from the owner. He does not return phone calls. I feel that Trip Advisor should warn people about the use of Miami Condo Oasis at the Mutiny Hotel in Coconut Grove, Miami, Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Great view...Great location South/East Miami”
Reviews.Author: Woody134
Reviews.Content: The area is great.......staff was wonderful from the Parking attendents to the front desk. Maid service was adequate. Rooms needed a good dusting and carpets were in sad shape. No washer and dryer as advertised. Room was non-smoking but there were visible burn marks on sofa bed and on bedspread in bedroom. Kitchen equipment was in working order. Staff should leave dishwashing detergent to run dishwasher. Parking was quick and efficient. Tipping didn't seem to get car any faster. But again ground floor staff was friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “the mutiny is awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Mutiny in Coconut Grove was awesome. My wife and I went there(in our late 20's) after getting it off of Hotwire for $87/night. We told them it was our anniversary and they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite with a lovely view. PROS- the staff is amazing. They were very attentive and if we asked the concierge or housekeeping for anything it was done immediately. They even got us on the guest list at the fancy south beach clubs including Privee Rooms- the kitchen and living area were awesome. They had every appliance and brand new china and cookware. The living room had a tv, queen sofabed, and vcr and dvd player. Bedroom was nice with a comfortable bed Bathroom- was okay. Kind of small and did not have a bath tub. Did have bath and body works supplies though POOL- was nice and private with towels, robes provided. Free USA TODAY AND MIAMI HERALD EVERYDAY INSIDER TIPS go to Cafe TU TU TANGO- it is affordable and nice. Get the Caya chicken wings and the MANGO BBQ pizza. ALso got to MAMBO- they have a special where you get a bottle of wine, an appetizer, 2 entrees, 2 desserts, and coffee for $34 total at night. Also they have a buisness center with high speed internet and a printer for free. Parking- A lot behind the hotel for 5$ for an 8 hour period. Valet is 16 but worth it. They bring your car down super fast. OVERALL we loved the hotel because of its location near cocowalk and all nice stores, restuarants. Only 15 minutes to south beach. THE staff is fabulous and the suites are nice

Reviews.Title: “"Miami Condo Oasis" -- pro's and con's of private condos”
Reviews.Author: RutgersGuy
Reviews.Content: The Mutiny Hotel contains a number of private condos, some of which are rented by the owners. Some owners go through the Hotel's rental program, while others advertise on the Internet and rent directly. We made a reservation for a 2 bedroom condo at the Mutiny advertised as "Miami Condo Oasis" at FloridaVactions(--) As a family of 4 we prefer the space in a 2 bedroom condo which has a separate living room/dining area, as well as 2 bathrooms. This condo is quite lovely, on the 7th floor overlooking the pool and the bay. The living room has a nice flat screen TV on the wall and good cable selections. The master bedroom is large and comfortable with its own attached bathroom, including bidet. There is no maid service, but there are plenty of linens and towels, and there is a washer/dryer in the unit. The second bedroom is a bit of a disappointment. It is quite small and has bunk beds which fill up most of the space in the room. Small kids might find it fun, but our teenager preferred to sleep on the living room sofa. Pro's: Lovely condo at a price which is about a third less than renting directly from the hotel; free parking Con's: 1. No maid service 2. the A/C has a lock on it so you cannot adjust it yourself. While we were there it was set at 74, which was warmer than we like. Make sure the owner sets the temperature where you like it. 3. Although owner's units are entitled to free parking, there was a lot of confusion with security about using it. 4.Finally, the owner requires a $500 security deposit which is supposed to be returned after 2 weeks. It look me a month to get our security deposit back, and only after the owner lied to me twice about having put it in the mail. Only when I was about to start making complaints to the hotel, to Pay-Pal (which he uses to receive payments), and to the sites he advertises at did he return my money via pay-pal. This was an unnecessary annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel are the washer and dryer in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: ecove
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 4-night stay at the Mutiny with my wife, and we really enjoyed it. Just to be clear, this is NOT the place for you if you're looking for super-luxury, or pampering. But if you're looking for a very comfortable place, well-run, quiet, then the Mutiny is worth considering. We were in a 1BR suite; the bedroom was small, but the bed itself was comfortable. The living room was more spacious, and the small kitchen was well-equipped. Modern bathroom, very clean throughout the place. The couch was a little cheapo. The pool was excellent - comfortable deck chairs, nice jacuzzi, plenty of sun (don't blieve the other poster who said there was none). This place felt like a 3-star to me.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Dear”
Reviews.Author: roger39
Reviews.Content: The Mutiny is meant to be a four star hotel. The location is the only thing about it that might possibly justify this rating. It is five minute walk from Coconut Grove, in the evenings a lively restaurant and club area. And the front of the hotel has great views over Biscayne Bay.But the back, where our room was, has views of a busy large multi story car park which, if you stand on the balcony, is almost within touching distance. The public areas of the hotel that we saw were cramped shabby and out of date.The lift was dusty and dirty .Our apartment , which was a one bedded suite, had three rooms. The bathroom lived up to the four star rating ; it had recently been re decorated and looked fresh and clean. In contrast the bedroom was small and dark . The queen sized bed and television stand practically filled all the available space. The bedspread looked shabby and not very clean.The living room had a cooker,microwave, fridge, small eating table with two chairs and a sofa bed. The furniture was scratched chipped and of poor quality. The sofa bed looked old and worn .It sagged in the middle and must have given anyone who slept on it bad back ache. The balcony had not been cleaned for a long time.It was filthy. All the windows to the balcony, living room and bedroom were dirty with bits of mud etc splattered across them restricting the light and making it quite difficult to see out clearly.. This was 6 weeks after Wilma. And all it needed to clean the balcony windows was to open the door, walk outside onto the balcony, and clean them. The whole accommodation w as clearly unacceptable in a four star hotel. I went down to reception and complained. I offered to pay more for a better room .I was told they were full and nothing w as available. Our stay at the Mutiny was to be the grand finale of our trip. A little luxury in the big city before we flew home, after two weeks spent travelling through the country towns of Florida. There was no alternative but to search for other accommodation. It was the week of Thanksgiving. Everything w as likely to be booked up. So we had to try several hotels before we could eventually find one which could take us for the four days required. I then returned to the Mutiny front desk and checked out; an hour or so after checking in. This time the front desk manager was present. He asked what my complaints were. I told him., he apologised, and said he used to work for what he described as â€œ a proper hotelâ€� before he came to the Mutiny. The problem apparently is that all the suites in the Mutiny are owned by individuals and the hotel management company just acts as their agent in letting them out when the owner does not wish to use them. So their ability to control the quality of the accommodation etc is clearly not optimum. We paid $130 through Hotwire. Maybe . because we were Hotwire customers, we were given the worst room in the hotel. I do not know. All I do know is that given the accommodation we were allocated and the public areas we saw, this hotel should not be regarded as a four star ;at the most two.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a hotel that understands service!”
Reviews.Author: NicoJones
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Miami over the years at various hotels. Typically I stay in South Beach, but this trip I had some business in Coconut Grove and decided to give the Mutiny a try. Thank goodness I did. First, let me start by saying that the quality of the hotel is excellent. The rooms are large and I had a great view of the bay. The flowers in the bathrooms were unique and added a nice touch of color. The restaurant is quaint and their specials are the way to go. The service that I received at the Mutiny was exactly what I have been looking for...courteous, friendly, inviting...everything you would expect when you visit dear friends. I had never seen a hotel where EVERYONE was genuine and enjoyed being there; until now. I will definitely return to the Mutiny. It is now my "home away from home!!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Views... Icy service”
Reviews.Author: IzzyS01
Reviews.Content: Our room was had a gorgeous view of Sailboat Bay. With the full kitchen, it made happy hour on our balcony, the best bar in the city. The room itself was slightly average to below. The rooms were a bit worn. Small tv in the den, and no TV in one of the bedrooms. The view and conveinent location made it worth while. However, we had four people splitting the cost of the room. The price of rooms here would suggest swankier accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed during the memorial holiday weekend and it was the most disappointing stay that I have ever had in a hotel. The ocean view that was promised was a figment of their imagination, there was no view of any type of water any where the electrical appliances did not work, the ambiance was much to be desired, the response from hotel personnel was nil it was a very disappointing experience. If this hotel is an indication of the five star quality that was recommended then the public is being cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: steevie
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. My room was essentially a 1 br apartment with a full kitchen. The pool area is beautiful. The location can't be beat. I did notice that the front desk staff seemed a little bit out of control from time to time, but I never had any problems personally. The staff were all really nice and I had a wonderful stay. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - with some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I generally like to stay at hotels that I normally couldnt afford, but for which I can get a good deal. I needed a fun March Break Vacation for my wife and myself and we settled on Miami and wanted some place relatively quiet. Mutiny Hotel - is lovely - furnished nicely, rooms are great and the suite concept is wonderful. It is impeccably clean and I liked that the pool area had some shade. The Concierge and Bell Captains were polite and very helpful. But there were some problems. I booked a room on-line at a very reasonable rate (read, cheap). I have done that before with large chain hotels and never been penalized by my room selection - either for an upgrade or slotted into less desirable rooms. At the Mutiny, I was. They sell off their less desirable rooms to on-line services and hence the more reasonable rates. Their cheaper rooms are located at the back of the hotel near a large (10 storey) parking garage. Our balcony looked onto it from the kitchen and we were on the 8th Floor of the hotel. At the back of the hotel is the service elevator and garbage chute which can be a bit loud given the walls in the hotel are a bit thin. Some of the Clientele was also an issue. This hotel seems to be popular for pre-Cruise stays in Miami. Which wasn't a problem for most of the week, but one day a large group in the hotel were marshelling in the corridors to get ready for their trip - - - at 6 am. The walls in the hotel are relatively thin - and it was loud. Housekeeping was also an issue. The service cleaned very well and were very polite - - - but I consistently had to ask to have our suite cleaned at 4pm. We tip housekeeping, and my expectation based upon other hotels is that most rooms are normally cleaned by that time in the afternoon. At the Mutiny - it did not seem to be a priority. Coconut Grove is small but cute, I can recommend: Cafe Tu Tu Tange - Tapas style - inexpenssive lunch Senior Frogs - lower cost mexican cuisine - good food, nothing fancy Cafe Med - in Coco walk - doesn't look like much - excellent "american" fare and excellent service for lunch - great prices. Le Bouchon du Grove - French Bistro - make a reservation - well cooked, acceptable service, wonderful atmosphere - standrard Bistro fare. Jaguar - new just opened - civiche a speciality - south american cuisine excellently prepared - adventerous palate required. Had shrimp three ways - one with a piri piri suace - very well done Green Street - best pasta dish in while - all boulevard seating, reservation recommended, see and be seen eatery. Very nice. Le Moulin de Grove - crepes a specialty - wonderful spot for a breakfast or lunch Bacio Gelato - very well done Italian gelato creamery - dont order a large it is filling ! :) As you can gather - food is the biggest draw in the Grove...

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had just 2 days in Miami after a cruise and wanted a central location that wasn't A. scary (like downtown Miami) or B. loud and expensive (South Beach). The Mutiny was perfect- we went west to the Everglades one day, and east to the Seaquarium and the Keys the next. The hotel isn't cheap, but for the price you get a huge suite with a kitchen, good (though not excellent) service, and are within walking distance to the shopping and cafe's of Cocowalk. A tip: park in the lot behind the hotel- $5 per night rather than the $16/day for valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Room/Lousy Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation in August 2004 for a 2 bedroom suite overlooking the bay during the week of Christmas. Our plans were to stay at the hotel for 2 nights. Upon our arrival, we were told our room was moved to one side of the building. Instead of 2 bedrooms, we were issued two rooms with one bedroom in each. Our party had 6 people. We went up to our rooms on the third floor (which we were told by desk staff they had a view of the bay), and found they overlooked the garbage cans, trees and parking garage. After complaining to the office staff, we were informed that a mistake was made and there was nothing they could do. In fact the reservations manager (on vacation) told us via front desk staff to go to another hotel if we were not happy with our room. Great customer service. Not! We asked the hotel manager, who didn't come in until the next day, to find us a better room. He said there was nothing he could as they were booked up and the hotel next door, who had nice views, was booked. We knew this wasn't true as the Hotel Sonesta next door had rooms when we asked. The only thing he could do was give us one night free. The damage had already been done and staying there a few nights looking at garbage cans was not the highlight of our trip. Never have we been treated so poorly at a hotel and we would not recommend this place to anyone. They are not honest and do nothing to satisfy their customers. Plus their ad says that all rooms have "city views or bay views." That is a joke. Our room was $259/night for a garbage can view. Even the garbage people woke us up early the next day at 6:45 a.m. to empty their caninsters. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bonn2
Reviews.Content: The Mutiny has a great 'old world' atmosphere through nice furniture with an eye for details. The staff is mainly native Spanish speaking (with also very good English) and very nice and friendly, which again adds to the 'old world' feeling. On arrival we got an upgrade from a studio to a one bedroom suite without having asked for it. The location is excellent, short walking distance to Cocowalk, nice marina outside the hotel. I feel the other reviews are not giving justice to the place. The reason for giving four not five points is parking, which is difficult in the area and the only option was the hotel's valet parking for 16 USD+tax+tipp/day.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: JeannieStu
Reviews.Content: The suites are a nice size. Recommend a room that overlooks the pool or marina. The service in this hotel is awful. Pulled my own bags out of the trunk of the car. Staff barely speaks english. They do not know where anything is. Asked for directions to several places had to go through 4 people to get them. Conceirge is non-existent. No beach near the hotel. Phones in the rooms were so messed up that we had to go down to the front desk to ask questions. Air conditioner in the room is extremely loud.

Reviews.Title: “Mutiny worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Mutiny the first in March 'O3. The staff was always friendly and polite. thought the service was spotty at times. For example, on one occaision I returned the rental car to the valet parkers with two young children, bags of grocerys and a stroller to contend with. The valet guys watched me struggle the whole time without even opening my car door. This was a one off, however, and though annoying, I certainly didn't base my overall opinion on the incident. Teh Suite (1bed, king) was very comfortable, though on the smallish side. We didn't have a balcony but that was okay with an aspiring 18mth old crawler in tow. The pool area is very pretty and great for young children. They make a mean 'rum-runner' drink in the bar that you can obviously drink poolside. Teh Pirates bar was decent, nothing amazing, but fine if you are hungrey and can't be bothered to drag yourself away from the pool in search of a restaurant. The hot tub is divine and close to the pool so you can watch the kids easily. The pool is supposedly heated but wasn't very warm. Apparently, if you tell the front desk they will warm it up. Location is unbeatable. A block from Cocowalk and next to a playground. The Mutiny is decorated beautifully with plenty of beautiful people about. Great for families, plus the young free and single bunch. Paid $159 + tax, parking a night, got upgraded from jr. 1bed to full 1bed. with washer-dryer off teh kitchenette. We would return again with the kids because off the separate bedroom and nice (small, shallow) pool.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: thankx
Reviews.Content: I had made reservations for The Mutiny Hotel for a large group a few months prior to arrival. The reservationist said we would have bay views, which sounded promising. Upon check-in I asked again about the bay views and they said we would have partial views which was fine with me. When we went to our rooms, there was garbage below and trees blocking a view of anything. When I spoke to the reservationist, she said the lady booking me was new and had made a mistake. I said, I'm sorry, that is not my problem, I would like bay views, as I promised my party. They then moved me to a different room, which had the same view, and then asked me to pay $20.00 for the upgrade. The whole time, they said the manager would be back, and then said she was gone. They said they were booked, (which wasn't true according to the bellhop and another employee). They put excuses after excuses and had me wait for 45 minutes where they then miraculously found a choice of two rooms, (despite the fact of being booked, ha ha, in low season), which miraculously had bay views. Of course they only offered this to me and not my other guests. I found the customer service to be rude and they also lied to me throughout my questions of what was promised. I would certainly not recommend going to somewhere that blames everyone but does nothing to rectify the situation. I was looking forward to enjoying my stay, but when you promise a bay view and then give your guests garbage to look at below, I find this shady. Better luck to you.

HotelInfo.Name: The Mutiny Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2951 South Bayshore Drive, Miami, FL 33133
